Title.evidence: Validation of the nProfiler 1 Stomach Cancer Assay in a Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with stage III gastric cancer post-gastrectomy were randomised to SP or DS.

Participants.evidence: Patients with stage III gastric cancer post-gastrectomy were randomised to SP or DS.

Intervention.evidence: comparing S-1 plus cisplatin (SP) and S-1 plus docetaxel (DS).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to validate nProfiler1 using a cohort from the POST trial.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was disease-free survival (DFS) over a median follow-up of 57.9 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 153 randomised patients, 118 were analysed (60 SP, 58 DS) using a post-hoc approach.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 153 randomised patients, 118 were analysed (60 SP, 58 DS) using a post-hoc approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference in DFS or overall survival (OS) was observed between groups.

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
